optimization.algorithms.base¶

Source: src\optimization\algorithms\base.py

Module Overview¶

Base classes for optimization algorithms.

Advanced Mathematical Theory¶

Base Algorithm Structure¶

Iterative optimization template:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} & \text{Initialize: } \vec{x}^0 \in \mathcal{X} \\ & \text{Repeat until convergence:} \\ & \quad \vec{x}^{t+1} = \mathcal{U}(\vec{x}^t, \nabla f(\vec{x}^t), \ldots) \\ & \quad \text{Check: } \|\vec{x}^{t+1} - \vec{x}^t\| < \epsilon \end{align}\end{split}\]

Where \(\mathcal{U}\) is algorithm-specific update rule.

Population-Based vs Gradient-Based¶

Population-based:

  • Derivative-free

  • Global search capability

  • Parallel evaluation

  • No gradient information needed

Gradient-based:

  • Local convergence guarantees

  • Fast convergence near optimum

  • Requires differentiability

  • Sequential evaluation

Convergence Analysis¶

Deterministic convergence:

\[\lim_{t \to \infty} \|\vec{x}^t - \vec{x}^*\| = 0\]

Stochastic convergence (in probability):

\[\lim_{t \to \infty} P(\|\vec{x}^t - \vec{x}^*\| > \epsilon) = 0\]

Exploration vs Exploitation¶

Diversity metric for population \(\vec{X}\):

\[D(\vec{X}) = \frac{1}{N(N-1)} \sum_{i=1}^{N} \sum_{j \neq i}^{N} \|\vec{x}_i - \vec{x}_j\|\]

Exploitation ratio:

\[R_{exploit} = \frac{\text{Iterations near } \vec{x}_{best}}{\text{Total iterations}}\]

Performance Metrics¶

Convergence rate:

\[\rho = \frac{\log(f^t - f^*) - \log(f^{t+1} - f^*)}{1}\]

  • \(\rho > 1\): Superlinear

  • \(\rho = 1\): Linear

  • \(\rho < 1\): Sublinear

Architecture Diagram¶

graph TD A[Initialize Population] --> B[Evaluate Fitness] B --> C[Update Personal Best] C --> D[Update Global Best] D --> E[Update Population] E --> F[Convergence Check] F --> G{Converged?} G -->|No| B G -->|Yes| H[Return Result] F --> I{Max Iterations?} I -->|Yes| H I -->|No| J{Stagnation?} J -->|Yes| K[Diversity Injection] K --> B J -->|No| B style F fill:#ff9 style G fill:#9cf style H fill:#9f9

Usage Examples¶

Example 1: Basic Initialization¶

from src.optimization.core import *

# Initialize with configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = Component(config)

Example 2: Performance Tuning¶

# Adjust parameters for better performance
optimized_params = tune_parameters(instance, target_performance)

Example 3: Integration with Optimization¶

# Use in complete optimization loop
optimizer = create_optimizer(opt_type, config)
result = optimize(optimizer, problem, max_iter=100)

Example 4: Edge Case Handling¶

try:
    output = instance.compute(parameters)
except ValueError as e:
    handle_edge_case(e)

Example 5: Performance Analysis¶

# Analyze metrics
metrics = compute_metrics(result)
print(f"Best fitness: {metrics.best_fitness:.3f}")

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#======================== src/optimization/algorithms/base.py =========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Base classes for optimization algorithms."""
  6
  7from __future__ import annotations
  8
  9from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
 10from typing import Any, Dict
 11
 12from ..core.interfaces import OptimizationProblem, ParameterSpace, OptimizationResult
 13
 14
 15class OptimizationAlgorithm(ABC):
 16    """Abstract base class for optimization algorithms.
 17
 18    This class defines the common interface that all optimization algorithms
 19    must implement. It provides a standard structure for algorithm initialization,
 20    execution, and result reporting.
 21    """
 22
 23    def __init__(self):
 24        """Initialize the optimization algorithm."""
 25        self.name = self.__class__.__name__
 26        self.is_initialized = False
 27        self.current_iteration = 0
 28
 29    @abstractmethod
 30    def optimize(self,
 31                problem: OptimizationProblem,
 32                parameter_space: ParameterSpace,
 33                **kwargs) -> OptimizationResult:
 34        """Run the optimization algorithm.
 35
 36        Parameters
 37        ----------
 38        problem : OptimizationProblem
 39            The optimization problem to solve
 40        parameter_space : ParameterSpace
 41            The parameter space to search over
 42        **kwargs
 43            Additional algorithm-specific parameters
 44
 45        Returns
 46        -------
 47        OptimizationResult
 48            The optimization results
 49        """
 50        pass
 51
 52    def get_algorithm_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 53        """Get information about the algorithm.
 54
 55        Returns
 56        -------
 57        dict
 58            Algorithm information including name, parameters, and current state
 59        """
 60        return {
 61            'name': self.name,
 62            'is_initialized': self.is_initialized,
 63            'current_iteration': self.current_iteration
 64        }
 65
 66    def reset(self):
 67        """Reset the algorithm to initial state."""
 68        self.is_initialized = False
 69        self.current_iteration = 0
 70
 71    def supports_constraints(self) -> bool:
 72        """Check if algorithm supports constraints.
 73
 74        Returns
 75        -------
 76        bool
 77            True if constraints are supported
 78        """
 79        return False
 80
 81    def supports_parallel_evaluation(self) -> bool:
 82        """Check if algorithm supports parallel function evaluation.
 83
 84        Returns
 85        -------
 86        bool
 87            True if parallel evaluation is supported
 88        """
 89        return False
 90
 91    def get_default_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 92        """Get default algorithm parameters.
 93
 94        Returns
 95        -------
 96        dict
 97            Default parameter values
 98        """
 99        return {}
100
101
102class PopulationBasedAlgorithm(OptimizationAlgorithm):
103    """Base class for population-based optimization algorithms.
104
105    This class extends OptimizationAlgorithm with common functionality
106    for algorithms that maintain a population of candidate solutions.
107    """
108
109    def __init__(self, population_size: int = 50):
110        """Initialize population-based algorithm.
111
112        Parameters
113        ----------
114        population_size : int
115            Size of the population
116        """
117        super().__init__()
118        self.population_size = population_size
119        self.population = None
120        self.generation = 0
121
122    def get_algorithm_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
123        """Get algorithm information including population details."""
124        info = super().get_algorithm_info()
125        info.update({
126            'population_size': self.population_size,
127            'generation': self.generation,
128            'has_population': self.population is not None
129        })
130        return info
131
132    def reset(self):
133        """Reset the algorithm including population."""
134        super().reset()
135        self.population = None
136        self.generation = 0
137
138    def supports_parallel_evaluation(self) -> bool:
139        """Population-based algorithms typically support parallel evaluation."""
140        return True
141
142
143class GradientBasedAlgorithm(OptimizationAlgorithm):
144    """Base class for gradient-based optimization algorithms.
145
146    This class extends OptimizationAlgorithm with common functionality
147    for algorithms that use gradient information.
148    """
149
150    def __init__(self, gradient_tolerance: float = 1e-6):
151        """Initialize gradient-based algorithm.
152
153        Parameters
154        ----------
155        gradient_tolerance : float
156            Tolerance for gradient convergence
157        """
158        super().__init__()
159        self.gradient_tolerance = gradient_tolerance
160        self.current_gradient = None
161        self.gradient_evaluations = 0
162
163    def get_algorithm_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
164        """Get algorithm information including gradient details."""
165        info = super().get_algorithm_info()
166        info.update({
167            'gradient_tolerance': self.gradient_tolerance,
168            'gradient_evaluations': self.gradient_evaluations,
169            'has_gradient': self.current_gradient is not None
170        })
171        return info
172
173    def reset(self):
174        """Reset the algorithm including gradient information."""
175        super().reset()
176        self.current_gradient = None
177        self.gradient_evaluations = 0
178
179    def requires_gradients(self) -> bool:
180        """Check if algorithm requires analytical gradients.
181
182        Returns
183        -------
184        bool
185            True if analytical gradients are required
186        """
187        return False

Classes¶

OptimizationAlgorithm¶

Inherits from: ABC

Abstract base class for optimization algorithms.

This class defines the common interface that all optimization algorithms must implement. It provides a standard structure for algorithm initialization, execution, and result reporting.

Source Code¶

 1class OptimizationAlgorithm(ABC):
 2    """Abstract base class for optimization algorithms.
 3
 4    This class defines the common interface that all optimization algorithms
 5    must implement. It provides a standard structure for algorithm initialization,
 6    execution, and result reporting.
 7    """
 8
 9    def __init__(self):
10        """Initialize the optimization algorithm."""
11        self.name = self.__class__.__name__
12        self.is_initialized = False
13        self.current_iteration = 0
14
15    @abstractmethod
16    def optimize(self,
17                problem: OptimizationProblem,
18                parameter_space: ParameterSpace,
19                **kwargs) -> OptimizationResult:
20        """Run the optimization algorithm.
21
22        Parameters
23        ----------
24        problem : OptimizationProblem
25            The optimization problem to solve
26        parameter_space : ParameterSpace
27            The parameter space to search over
28        **kwargs
29            Additional algorithm-specific parameters
30
31        Returns
32        -------
33        OptimizationResult
34            The optimization results
35        """
36        pass
37
38    def get_algorithm_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
39        """Get information about the algorithm.
40
41        Returns
42        -------
43        dict
44            Algorithm information including name, parameters, and current state
45        """
46        return {
47            'name': self.name,
48            'is_initialized': self.is_initialized,
49            'current_iteration': self.current_iteration
50        }
51
52    def reset(self):
53        """Reset the algorithm to initial state."""
54        self.is_initialized = False
55        self.current_iteration = 0
56
57    def supports_constraints(self) -> bool:
58        """Check if algorithm supports constraints.
59
60        Returns
61        -------
62        bool
63            True if constraints are supported
64        """
65        return False
66
67    def supports_parallel_evaluation(self) -> bool:
68        """Check if algorithm supports parallel function evaluation.
69
70        Returns
71        -------
72        bool
73            True if parallel evaluation is supported
74        """
75        return False
76
77    def get_default_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
78        """Get default algorithm parameters.
79
80        Returns
81        -------
82        dict
83            Default parameter values
84        """
85        return {}

This class extends OptimizationAlgorithm with common functionality for algorithms that maintain a population of candidate solutions.

Source Code¶

 1class PopulationBasedAlgorithm(OptimizationAlgorithm):
 2    """Base class for population-based optimization algorithms.
 3
 4    This class extends OptimizationAlgorithm with common functionality
 5    for algorithms that maintain a population of candidate solutions.
 6    """
 7
 8    def __init__(self, population_size: int = 50):
 9        """Initialize population-based algorithm.
10
11        Parameters
12        ----------
13        population_size : int
14            Size of the population
15        """
16        super().__init__()
17        self.population_size = population_size
18        self.population = None
19        self.generation = 0
20
21    def get_algorithm_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
22        """Get algorithm information including population details."""
23        info = super().get_algorithm_info()
24        info.update({
25            'population_size': self.population_size,
26            'generation': self.generation,
27            'has_population': self.population is not None
28        })

34        self.population = None
35        self.generation = 0
36
37    def supports_parallel_evaluation(self) -> bool:
38        """Population-based algorithms typically support parallel evaluation."""
39        return True

Source Code¶

 1class GradientBasedAlgorithm(OptimizationAlgorithm):
 2    """Base class for gradient-based optimization algorithms.
 3
 4    This class extends OptimizationAlgorithm with common functionality
 5    for algorithms that use gradient information.
 6    """
 7

 9        """Initialize gradient-based algorithm.
10
11        Parameters
12        ----------
13        gradient_tolerance : float
14            Tolerance for gradient convergence
15        """
16        super().__init__()
17        self.gradient_tolerance = gradient_tolerance
18        self.current_gradient = None
19        self.gradient_evaluations = 0
20
21    def get_algorithm_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
22        """Get algorithm information including gradient details."""
23        info = super().get_algorithm_info()
24        info.update({
25            'gradient_tolerance': self.gradient_tolerance,
26            'gradient_evaluations': self.gradient_evaluations,
27            'has_gradient': self.current_gradient is not None
28        })
29        return info
30
31    def reset(self):
32        """Reset the algorithm including gradient information."""
33        super().reset()
34        self.current_gradient = None
35        self.gradient_evaluations = 0

44        """
45        return False
